title: How should the "in Attachment 5b" be prepared under section 5b of FL-100 (Petition-Marriage)? Is a spreadsheet adequate?
question: Form FL-100, section 5b, provides for the listing of assets and debts in 3 ways: 1) on the form itself, 2) FL-160, or 3) as an Attachment 5b. My assets and debt will not fit on the FL-100 or FL-160 when trying to type them into the document. If a spreadsheet is acceptable, what other information needs to be included (the same info as included in FL-160)?
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
I agree with Mr. Dwyer.

In fact, the *only* time I generally list assets on this form are when I anticipate that I will take the Respondent's default.

You can incorporate a spreadsheet if you wish. Many - who wish to have their assets immune from public scrutiny - will simply put "to be determined." Note that your Schedule of Assets and Debts does not have to be filed with the Court. Rather, you are only required to file a Proof of Service for your Declarations of Disclosure. Listing your assets and debts in your petition for dissolution unnecessarily IMO diminishes your privacy.
